author: bridgebuilders
title: Boosting Diversity in Catalyst
description: コミュニティとして、どうすれば多様性を高め、新しい人々やコミュニティをProject Catalystに取り込むことができるでしょうか？

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

The proposal's objective to bring new people into Catalyst supports the strategic goal of Fund8 to grow the number of contributors.

At the same time, the proposal does not provide an analysis of the relative effectivenes of its plan in comparison to regional-focused (grow LatAm, grow India, etc.) and gender-focused (Women of Cardano) challenges. There is a reason to believe that promoting diversity on a regional level can be more effective (have higher ROI) because of the ability to adapt to local languages and cultures. 

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point because this initiaitve supports only one of three strategic goals of Fund 8.
- 1 point for the lack of a clear analysis of alternative approaches to prove that focus on this user segment can bring high ROI to the community.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Catalyst community is definitely capable of bringing in new contributors and including them into its processes - the growth of the community from fund to fund is a clear indicator of that.

At the same time, the proposal would be stronger if it provided a detailed analysis of the problem (which particular segments are underrepresented) and discussed recent success stories vision helping to undestand the impact and necessary funding to make a noticeable impact..

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of an analysis of the problem.
- 1 point for the lack of a discussion about the sufficiency of the requested funds to achieve a noticeable impact.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal defines metrics (the number of new users, engagement, new communities, languages, etc.) that can track some progress.

At the same time those metrics are insufficient to track the progress towards fully solving the problem. The proposal would be stronger if it considered some of the following ideas and metrics:
1) clearly define which facets of diversity we believe it is important to track.
2) for each facet track the differences between the distributions of the community and that of the global population.
3) analyze community satisfaction by each facet and compare that vs those of competing projects.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating the relative impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating user satisfaction and the competitiveness of the solutions.
My rating is 3.

f6_assessments.q0: First of all is there a problem with lack of diversity in Project Catalyst and what is causing it ? It would be important to frame these and to define diversity (even if loosely) if we want to define good measures of success. I note that this challenge will intersect a lot in terms of it's goals with existing challenge such "Grow LATAM, Grow Cardano", "Multilingual resources", "Scale-up community Hubs", etc and fostering to diverse cultures is already covered by these. Saying this, i'm certain that there are many communities, specially under-privileged ones that we could do more to outreach too, and this is where i see this challenge having a positive impact.
f6_assessments.q1: A lot of the issues regarding "lack of diversity" are often structural and that will not be easy for the community to change or influence by itself. Note that Project Catalyst is an open platform, that anyone can join, so the challenge will be one of outreach and helping under-privileged (communities with lack of access to IT infrastructure). Saying this we have lots of good examples of funded proposals that aimed at tackling these issues, so the community has already demonstrated it is ready for it.
f6_assessments.q2:
Some of the metrics are not very relevant or measurable. For example how do you measure the number of new users onboarded into Cardano ? Also simply measuring the numbers of users or Catalyst community members added is not a measure of diversity. 
The number of new communities/countries/languages added to the conversation will also be hard to measure. Unless we start asking people for there cultural background information (which i don't think we can do) the only metrics i can think off would be to survey the community how on diverse they think the ecosystem is, or some material metrics such Number of people provided with IT access.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge seeks to bring in many new groups of people which is critical to achieving Cardano's mission. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than one of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: There are several challenges that overlap with this challenge by trying to increase diversity in the Catalyst community. Individually the community has the capacity to address the challenges however collectively these overlapping challenges would likely take up a larger portion of the budget than the community has the capacity to address unless other critical challenges get cut. Combining some of these overlapping challenges would have been a preferred option.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics and success criteria are fine however it is difficult to see how they would be measured without significant profiling, which may be a privacy concern to some members of the community.

f6_assessments.q0: Intended as a global, decetralized network, diversity onboarding is absolutely important for Cardanos mission, as it is also very well explained in the Challenge statement. This challenge will also have a huge societal impact.
f6_assessments.q1: Since the Cardano community grows in diversity already, they should be pretty competent to adress this challenge with many good proposals. The challenge has a credible challenge team and it is credible to achieve results in the set milestone times.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics are set up in a good, open manner that leaves space for many ideas and is yet verifiable.

importance: 世界を変えるためには、すべての人の声やアイデアを取り入れる必要があります。私たちの可能性を引き出し、インパクトを最大化するためには、多様性が必要です。
success: すべての人、グループ、文化が、会話の中で声を上げることができます。私たちは、あらゆる人、あらゆる場所からの意見を取り入れたソリューションを構築します。
